bt_pert_zh: What will be shown as “Excluded” is “Not a Case”.

en: Online data has been established within the initial few weeks in the COVID-19 Observatory (Figure 5), indicating the overall number of patients and rate per 10,000 patients of cases confirmed or under investigation, as well as where the virus is excluded.
zh: 已经在创建 COVID-19 天文台的最初几周内建立了在线数据（图 5），表明已确诊或正在调查的病例总数和每 10,000 名患者的比率，以及已排除该病毒的地点。
pert_zh: 在创建 COVID-19 天文台的最初几周内已经建立了在线数据（图 5），显示了已确诊或正在调查的病例总数和每 10,000 名患者的比率，以及已排除该病毒的地点。
bt_pert_zh: Online data ( Figure 5 ) had been established in the first weeks of creating the COVID-19 Observatory, showing the total number of cases confirmed or under investigation and the rate per 10,000 patients, as well as locations where the virus had been ruled out.

en: We have the option to move to twice weekly surveillance reports with a scope to change this to daily reporting.
zh: 我们可以选择每周两次提交监测报告，并且可以将其更改为每日报告。
pert_zh: 每周两次提交监测报告可以选择，并且可以将其更改为每日报告。
bt_pert_zh: Submitting monitoring reports twice a week is an option and can be changed to daily reporting.

en: We will continue virology sampling from our sentinel practices, rather than discontinuing as seasonal influenza declines.
zh: 我们将持续从预警诊所进行病毒学采样，而不是随着季节性流感的减少而终止。
pert_zh: 从预警诊所持续进行病毒学采样，而不是随着季节性流感的减少而终止。
bt_pert_zh: Virological sampling from alert clinics should continue rather than being terminated as seasonal influenza declines.

en: Additionally, we will recruit more surveillance practices.
zh: 此外，我们将招募更多的监测诊所。
pert_zh: 我们将招募更多的监测诊所。此外，
bt_pert_zh: We will recruit more surveillance clinics. In addition,

en: The RCGP RSC virology practices will aim to undertake 200-300 nasopharyngeal swabs per week across the RCGP RSC sentinel network, collecting specimens across all age bands.
zh: RCGP RSC 病毒学监测诊所的目标是每周在 RCGP RSC 预警网络中进行 200-300 次鼻咽拭子采集，从而采集各个年龄段的标本。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 病毒学监测诊所的目标是每周在 RCGP RSC 预警网络中进行 200-300 次鼻咽拭子采集，从而采集各个年龄段的标本，目标是。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC Virology Surveillance Clinic aims to collect specimens from all age groups by carrying out 200-300 nasopharyngeal swabs per week across the RCGP RSC Alert Network.

en: In addition to the inclusion criteria for influenza virology surveillance (ILI, acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis), participating practices will take nasopharyngeal swab samples from any people showing acute symptoms of LRTI if the onset of symptoms is within 7 days.
zh: 除了流感病毒学监测的纳入标准（ILI、急性支气管炎/细支气管炎）之外，如果在 7 天内出现 LRTI 急性症状，参与诊所还将从任何出现症状的患者中采集鼻咽拭子样本。
pert_zh: 如果在 7 天内出现 LRTI 急性症状，参与诊所将从任何出现症状的患者中采集鼻咽拭子样本，除了流感病毒学监测的纳入标准（ILI、急性支气管炎/细支气管炎）。
bt_pert_zh: Participating clinics will collect nasopharyngeal swab specimens from any symptomatic patient if acute symptoms of LRTI occur within 7 days, in addition to the inclusion criteria for influenza virological surveillance (ILI, acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis).

en: RCGP RSC research officers and practice liaison staff will manage practices to achieve a total national sample of 200-300 swabs per week.
zh: RCGP RSC 研究人员和诊所联络人员将管理相关诊所，以实现每周 200-300 个拭子的全国样本总数。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC研究人员和诊所联络人员将管理相关诊所，以实现全国每周200-300个拭子的样本总数。
bt_pert_zh: RCGP RSC researchers and clinic liaison staff will manage the relevant clinics to achieve a total sample volume of 200-300 swabs per week nationwide.

en: This could be increased if PHE modelers require more samples.
zh: 如果 PHE 建模人员需要更多样本，此数量可能会增加。
pert_zh: 此数量可能会增加，如果 PHE 建模人员需要更多样本。
bt_pert_zh: This number may increase if PHE modelers require more samples.

en: Samples from each practice would be spread across the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years and older
zh: 每个诊所的样本采集将分布在以下年龄段：<5 岁、5-17 岁、18-64 岁和 65 岁及以上
pert_zh: 样本采集将分布在每个诊所的以下年龄段：<5 岁、5-17 岁、18-64 岁和 65 岁及以上
bt_pert_zh: Sample collection will be distributed across the following age groups at each clinic: <5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years and older

en: Samples (swabs or serum) collected will be sent via prepaid envelopes addressed to the appropriate PHE laboratory for analysis.
zh: 采集的样本（拭子或血清）将通过预付信封发送到适当的 PHE 实验室进行分析。
pert_zh: 样本（拭子或血清）采集的将通过预付信封发送到适当的 PHE 实验室进行分析。
bt_pert_zh: Samples (swabs or serum) collected will be sent via prepaid envelope to the appropriate PHE laboratory for analysis.

en: All samples collected will be tested for the presence of influenza and COVID-19.
zh: 将对采集的所有样本进行流感和 COVID-19 检测。
pert_zh: 对采集的所有样本将进行流感和 COVID-19 检测。
bt_pert_zh: All samples collected will be tested for influenza and COVID-19.

en: Additionally, PHE will retrospectively test any influenza virology samples collected between early and mid-February 2020 for COVID-19.
zh: 此外，PHE 还将对 2020 年 2 月上旬至中旬期间采集的所有 COVID-19 流感病毒学样本进行回顾性检测。
pert_zh: PHE 还将对2020年2月上旬至中旬期间采集的所有COVID-19流感病毒学样本进行回顾性检测，此外。
bt_pert_zh: PHE will also retrospectively test all COVID-19 influenza virology samples collected between early and mid-February 2020.

en: Practices will still follow the PHE protocol for COVID-19 with respect to people at risk of infection who should be signposted down the containment pathway, rather than physically attend their practice.
zh: 诊所将继续遵循 PHE 制定的 COVID-19 方案，有感染风险者应转诊至控制通道，而不是亲自前往诊所就诊。
pert_zh: 感染风险者应转诊至控制通道而不是亲自前往诊所就诊，诊所将继续遵循 PHE 制定的 COVID-19 方案。
bt_pert_zh: Those at risk of infection should be referred to controlled access rather than attending the clinic in person, and the clinic will continue to follow the COVID-19 protocols set out by PHE.

en: Direct testing of those who attend surgery remains permitted, but we have also rolled out self-swabbing at home.
zh: 仍然允许对前往诊室的患者进行直接检测，但我们也已经推出家庭自我拭子采集。
pert_zh: 但我们也已经推出家庭自我拭子采集，仍然允许对前往诊室的患者进行直接检测。
bt_pert_zh: But we have also rolled out home self-swab collection, which still allows for direct testing of patients visiting the clinic.

en: Summary of processes are detailed in Multimedia Appendix 3.
zh: 流程总结详见多媒体附录 3。
pert_zh: 多媒体附录 3 中有详见流程总结。
bt_pert_zh: A detailed summary of the process is provided in Multimedia Appendix 3.

en: Everyone with an ILI or a respiratory illness who contacts a GP (eg, phones for an appointment) should be asked specifically about recent travel to China and other countries flagged in current PHE advice, or if they have had contact with other people with COVID-19.
zh: 对于每个与 GP 联系（例如，电话预约）并且患有 ILI 或呼吸道疾病的个人，都应该具体询问他们最近前往中国以及 PHE 建议中标记的其他国家的旅行史，或者他们是否与其他 COVID-19 患者有过接触。
pert_zh: 对于每个患有 ILI 或呼吸道疾病的个人，联系与 GP（例如，电话预约），都应该具体询问他们最近前往中国以及 PHE 建议中标记的其他国家的旅行史，或者他们是否与其他 COVID-19 患者有过接触。
bt_pert_zh: For every individual with ILI or respiratory illness who contacts a GP (e.g. for a telephone appointment), they should be specifically asked about their recent travel history to China and other countries flagged in PHE advice, or if they have had contact with other people with COVID-19.

en: If these screening enquiries are positive, the patient would be advised to not come to the practice but instead to follow the PHE flow sheet.
zh: 如果这些筛查询问得到了肯定的答复，则建议患者不要前往诊所，而是应该遵循 PHE 流程图。
pert_zh: 如果这些筛查询问得到了肯定的答复，则建议患者不要前往诊所，而是应该遵循 PHE 流程图。
bt_pert_zh: If these screening queries are answered positively, the patient is advised not to attend the clinic and should instead follow the PHE flow chart.

en: This can be by a reception or clinician staff, depending on individual practice protocol.
zh: 这可以由接待人员或临床工作人员决定，具体取决于个体诊所规程。
pert_zh: 具体取决于个体诊所的规程，这可以由临床工作人员或接待人员决定。
bt_pert_zh: Depending on the individual clinic’s protocols, this may be determined by clinical staff or reception staff.

en: These calls should be coded into the GP CMR system and can be reported as part of the RCGP RSC weekly return.
zh: 这些电话应编码至 GP CMR 系统，并可以作为 RCGP RSC 每周回报的一部分进行报告。
pert_zh: 这些电话应编码至 GP CMR 系统，并作为 RCGP RSC 每周回报的一部分进行报告。
bt_pert_zh: These calls should be coded to the GP CMR system and reported as part of the RCGP RSC weekly returns.

en: We have developed training material to support this coding (Multimedia Appendix 4).
zh: 我们已经开发出支持该编码的培训材料（多媒体附录 4）。
pert_zh: 支持该编码的培训材料（多媒体附录 4）已经被我们开发出来。
bt_pert_zh: Training materials (Multimedia Appendix 4) have been developed to support this coding.

en: These include prompt cards for:
zh: 这些包括以下提示卡：
pert_zh: 包括以下提示卡这些：
bt_pert_zh: Included are the following cue cards:

en: Practice reception or triage staff: for coding of any patients calling the practice with symptoms of acute respiratory infection with a history of travel to important areas based on PHE advice
zh: 诊所接待或分诊人员：根据 PHE 建议，对所有致电诊所并存在急性呼吸道感染症状以及重要地区旅行史的患者进行编码
pert_zh: 根据 PHE 建议，对所有致电诊所并存在急性呼吸道感染症状以及重要地区旅行史的患者进行编码，诊所接待或分诊人员。
bt_pert_zh: All patients calling the clinic with symptoms of acute respiratory infection and a history of travel to a significant area are coded by clinic reception or triage staff in accordance with PHE advice.

en: Administrative staff or clinicians who code: to encourage consistent coding of results for any suspected cases, including coding of negative results for exclusion
zh: 负责编码的行政人员或临床医生：鼓励对任何疑似病例进行一致的结果编码，包括对阴性结果进行排除编码
pert_zh: 鼓励行政人员或临床医生负责编码：对任何疑似病例进行一致的结果编码，包括对阴性结果进行排除编码。
bt_pert_zh: Encourage administrators or clinicians to take responsibility for coding: consistently code results for any suspected case, including ruling-out coding for negative results.

en: Practices participating in virology surveillance will opportunistically collect blood samples from patients coming into the practice for a routine blood test.
zh: 参加病毒学监测的诊所将适时从前往诊所进行常规血液检查的患者那里采集血样。
pert_zh: 参加病毒学监测的诊所将适时从前往诊所进行常规血液检查的患者那里采集血样。
bt_pert_zh: Clinics participating in virological surveillance will collect blood samples from patients who visit the clinic for routine blood tests, as appropriate.

en: Patients who attend their practice for a routine blood test will be asked to provide an additional sample for serology.
zh: 前往诊所进行常规血液检查的患者将被要求提供额外的血清学样本。
pert_zh: 患者前往诊所进行常规血液检查将被要求提供额外的血清学样本。
bt_pert_zh: Patients visiting the clinic for routine blood work will be asked to provide additional serology samples.

en: We have conducted initial searches within the RCGP RSC database to look at the number of full blood count (FBC) results and overall rates in adults and children (Figures 6-​-9).9).
zh: 我们已经在 RCGP RSC 数据库中进行了初步检索，以查看成人和儿童的全血细胞计数 (FBC) 结果的数量和总体比率（图 6--9).9）。
pert_zh: 在 RCGP RSC 数据库中，我们已经进行了初步检索，以查看成人和儿童的全血细胞计数（FBC）结果的数量和总体比率（图 6--9).9）。
bt_pert_zh: In the RCGP RSC database, we have performed a preliminary search to look at the number and overall ratios of complete blood count (FBC) results for adults and children ( Figures 6--9). 9 ).

en: An FBC is one of the most common tests performed, and we hope this will give an approximate indication of overall numbers of blood tests performed.
zh: FBC 是最常进行的检测项目之一，我们希望这能大致显示出进行血液检测的总数。
pert_zh: 我们希望这能大致显示出进行血液检测的总数，FBC 是最常进行的检测项目之一。
bt_pert_zh: We hope this gives a rough indication of the total number of blood tests performed, with FBC being one of the most commonly performed tests.

en: The sampling rate, per 100,000 patients was highest for children 15-17 years of age and 60 year or older in adults, with the lowest rates in children 0-4 years of age and 18-29 years of age in adults (Figures 6-​-99).
zh: 每 10 万名患者的采样率在 15-17 岁的儿童以及 60 岁或以上成人中最高，而在 0-4 岁的儿童以及 18-29 岁的成人中最低（图 6--99）。
pert_zh: 每 10 万名患者的采样率在 15-17 岁的儿童以及 60 岁或以上成人中最高，而在 0-4 岁的儿童以及 18-29 岁的成人中最低（图 6--99）。
bt_pert_zh: The sampling rate per 100,000 patients was highest among children aged 15-17 years and adults aged 60 years or older and lowest among children aged 0-4 years and adults aged 18-29 years (Figure 6--99).

en: We will provide 1000 serology baseline samples across all ages that reflect the varying rates of attendance by age.
zh: 我们将提供 1000 个不同年龄段的血清学基线样本，用于反映各年龄段到场率的差异。
pert_zh: 我们将提供 用于反映各年龄段到场率的差异的 1000 个不同年龄段的血清学基线样本。
bt_pert_zh: We will provide 1000 serological baseline samples of different age groups to reflect the differences in attendance rates among age groups.

en: Additionally, we will test if we can obtain these all from virology practices to enhance the yield.
zh: 此外，我们将测试能否从病毒学监测诊所中获得所有这些信息以提高产出。
pert_zh: 此外，我们将测试能否从病毒学监测诊所中获得所有这些信息以提高产出。
bt_pert_zh: Furthermore, we will test whether all this information can be obtained from virological surveillance clinics to improve output.

en: A good geographical spread is important, so PHE can advise on areas where serology will most usefully be collected.
zh: 合理的地域分布非常重要，因此 PHE 可以对采集血清学样本最有用的区域提供建议。
pert_zh: 因此 PHE 可以对采集血清学样本最有用的区域提供建议，合理的地域分布非常重要。
bt_pert_zh: PHE can therefore provide advice on areas where it would be most useful to collect serological samples, and appropriate geographical distribution is important.

en: This will be followed by 800 samples monthly.
zh: 随后每月将提供 800 个样本。
pert_zh: 每月将随后提供 800 个样本。
bt_pert_zh: 800 samples will subsequently be provided each month.

en: The sample will be stratified with 200 specimens for prepandemic survey (100 for monthly) in the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years or older.
zh: 样本将按照以下年龄组对用于疫情前调查（每月 100 个）的 200 个样本进行分层：<5 岁、5-17 岁、18-64 岁和 65 岁或以上。
pert_zh: 按照以下年龄组对用于疫情前调查的 200 个样本进行分层：<5 岁、5-17 岁、18-64 岁和 65 岁或以上，每月100个样本。
bt_pert_zh: The 200 samples used for the pre-outbreak survey were stratified by age groups: <5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years or older, with 100 samples per month.

en: The younger patients, in many practices younger than 14 years, and in nearly all for children younger than 8 years will require pediatric serology surveillance.
zh: 在许多诊所中，年龄小于 14 岁的年轻患者以及几乎所有 8 岁以下的儿童都需要进行儿科血清学监测。
pert_zh: 在许多诊所中，年龄小于 14 岁的年轻患者以及几乎所有 8 岁以下的儿童都需要进行儿科血清学监测。
bt_pert_zh: In many clinics, young patients younger than 14 years of age and nearly all children younger than 8 years of age require pediatric serologic surveillance.

en: We will develop a new request form for practices to capture recent travel and exposure to COVID-19.
zh: 我们将为诊所开发新的申请表，以记录近期旅行史和 COVID-19 暴露情况。
pert_zh: 为诊所开发新的申请表，记录近期旅行史和 COVID-19 暴露情况将会是我们的目标。
bt_pert_zh: It will be a goal to develop a new application form for clinics that documents recent travel history and COVID-19 exposure.

en: We will pilot a scheme for collecting convalescent serology from people with confirmed cases and who have had an acute virology sample at the time of their infection.
zh: 我们将试行一项计划，从已确诊病例以及在感染时已获得急性病毒学样本的患者中采集康复期血清学样本。
pert_zh: 从已确诊病例以及在感染时已获得急性病毒学样本的患者中，我们将试行一项计划，采集康复期血清学样本。
bt_pert_zh: We will pilot a program to collect convalescent serological samples from confirmed cases and from patients for whom acute virological samples were obtained at the time of infection.

en: This is to identify a carrier state in patients who have recovered from the virus but may continue shedding the virus.
zh: 这是为了确定已经康复但可能继续释放病毒的患者的携带者状态。
pert_zh: 为了确定已经康复但可能继续释放病毒的患者的携带者状态，这是。
bt_pert_zh: This is to determine the carrier status of patients who have recovered but may continue to shed the virus.

en: If there are a small number of cases, this may assist in developing a test kit for patients to take to their own GP and explore its acceptability to patients.
zh: 如果病例数量很少，这可能有助于为患者开发一套检测试剂盒，以带给他们自己的 GP 并探讨其对患者的可接受性。
pert_zh: 如果病例数量很少，这可能有助于为患者开发一套检测试剂盒，以带给他们自己的 GP 并探讨其对患者的可接受性。
bt_pert_zh: If the number of cases is low, it may be helpful to develop a test kit for patients to take to their own GP and explore its acceptability to patients.

en: If there are a large number of COVID-19 cases nationally, convalescent samples could be collected from RCGP RSC practices where there are confirmed cases, with the ability to link to the full medical record.
zh: 如果在全国范围内有大量 COVID-19 病例，则可以从已确诊病例并具有与完整病历关联能力的 RCGP RSC 诊所中采集康复期样本。
pert_zh: 如果在全国范围内有大量 COVID-19 病例，则可以从具有与完整病历关联能力的 RCGP RSC 诊所中采集康复期样本，已确诊病例。
bt_pert_zh: If there is a high number of COVID-19 cases nationally, convalescent samples could be collected from RCGP RSC clinics that have the capability to link to full medical records, confirmed cases.

en: This process may include checking pseudonymized NHS numbers for positive individuals at RCGP RSC practices, checking current PHE guidance regarding considerations of infectiousness for confirmed cases, and offering the patient an appointment following the previously mentioned process.
zh: 该过程可能包括核对 RCGP RSC 诊所内阳性个体的匿名化 NHS 编号，核对有关已确诊病例传染性考虑因素的现行 PHE 指南，以及按照上述流程为患者提供预约。
pert_zh: 可能包括核对 RCGP RSC 诊所内阳性个体的匿名化 NHS 编号，核对现行 PHE 指南有关已确诊病例传染性考虑因素，以及按照上述流程为患者提供预约该过程。
bt_pert_zh: This may include checking the anonymised NHS number of the positive individual within the RCGP RSC clinic, checking current PHE guidance on infectiousness considerations for confirmed cases, and offering the patient an appointment for this process as outlined above.

en: This needs to be carefully coordinated nationally across the network and may require PHE to ensure individuals are not contacted by multiple agencies.
zh: 这需要在整个网络内进行周密地全国性协调，并可能要求 PHE 确保不会由多个机构联系个人。
pert_zh: 这需要周密地在整个网络内进行全国性协调，并可能要求 PHE 确保不会由多个机构联系个人。
bt_pert_zh: This will require careful national coordination across the network and may require PHE to ensure that individuals are not contacted by more than one agency.

en: RCGP RSC could provide a useful structure to channel the initial contact once PHE has made a request.
zh: 一旦 PHE 发出申请，RCGP RSC 即可提供一种有用的结构来引导初始联系人。
pert_zh: 一旦 PHE 发出申请，RCGP RSC 即可提供一种有用的结构来引导初始联系人。
bt_pert_zh: Once a PHE has made an application, the RCGP RSC can provide a useful structure to guide initial contacts.

en: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of a LRTI.
zh: 参与年度流感病毒学监测的 RCGP RSC 诊所已经开始从存在 LRTI 症状的患者中取样。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 诊所已经开始从参与年度流感病毒学监测的患者中取样存在 LRTI 症状的。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC clinic has begun sampling patients with LRTI symptoms from those participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance.

en: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
zh: 收到的所有样本正在进行流感和 COVID-19 检测。
pert_zh: 所有样本收到的正在进行流感和 COVID-19 检测。
bt_pert_zh: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.

en: The RCGP RSC will explore ways to collect convalescent samples from any patients tested positive for COVID-19 through the extension of the virological surveillance.
zh: RCGP RSC 将探索通过扩大病毒学监测从任何 COVID-19 检测结果呈阳性的患者中采集康复期样本的方法。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 将通过扩大病毒学监测探索采集康复期样本的方法，从任何 COVID-19 检测结果呈阳性的患者中。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC will explore methods of collecting convalescent samples through expanded virological surveillance, from any patient who tests positive for COVID-19.

en: From the start, we will be carefully curating data to ensure that it can be used for future studies.
zh: 从一开始，我们就将仔细整理数据以确保可用于将来的研究。
pert_zh: 从一开始，我们就将仔细整理数据以确保可用于将来的研究。整理数据以确保可用于将来的研究，我们从一开始就将会。
bt_pert_zh: From the outset, we will carefully organize the data to ensure that it can be used for future research.

en: Our clinical data will be linked to virology.
zh: 我们的临床数据将与病毒学样本相关联。
pert_zh: 我们的临床数据将与病毒学样本相关联。
bt_pert_zh: Our clinical data will be linked to the virology samples.

en: We will curate our data using the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable principles.
zh: 我们将使用“可查找、可访问、可共同操作、可重新使用”的原则来整理数据。
pert_zh: 使用“可查找、可访问、可共同操作、可重新使用”的原则来整理数据，我们将。
bt_pert_zh: Using the principles of "findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable" to organize data, we will.

en: To facilitate this our data set is listed with Health Data Research UK and the European Health Data Evidence Network.
zh: 为此，我们的数据集已在“英国健康数据研究中心”和“欧洲健康数据证据网络”中列出。
pert_zh: 我们的数据集已列出在“英国健康数据研究中心”和“欧洲健康数据证据网络”中，为此。
bt_pert_zh: Our datasets are listed in the UK Centre for Health Data Research and the European Health Data Evidence Network for this purpose.

en: The statistical methodology is in support of a policy approach to widespread disease outbreak, where so-called nonpharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used to respond to an emerging pandemic to produce disease suppression.
zh: 统计方法学支持针对广泛疾病爆发的政策方法，其中使用所谓的非药物干预措施 (NPI) 应对新出现的疫情以产生疾病抑制效果。
pert_zh: 统计方法学支持政策方法针对广泛疾病爆发，其中应对新出现的疫情以产生疾病抑制效果使用所谓的非药物干预措施（NPI）。
bt_pert_zh: Statistical methodology supports policy approaches to widespread disease outbreaks, where so-called non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used in response to emerging outbreaks to produce a disease suppressive effect.

en: This policy aims to reduce contact rates in the population and thereby reduce transmission of the virus.
zh: 该政策旨在降低人群中的接触率，从而减少病毒的传播。
pert_zh: 该政策旨在减少病毒的传播，从而降低人群中的接触率。
bt_pert_zh: The policy is intended to reduce the spread of the virus, thereby lowering contact rates among the population.

en: To implement this the UK government has recently articulated the desire to implement population self-isolation measures.
zh: 为了实现这一目标，英国政府最近明确表达了实施人群自我隔离措施的要求。
pert_zh: 英国政府最近明确表达了实施人群自我隔离措施的要求，为了实现这一目标。
bt_pert_zh: The British government has recently made it clear that it is necessary to implement self-isolation measures for the population in order to achieve this goal.

en: By targeting the reproduction number (R) (the average number of secondary cases each case generates) and aiming to reduce the R to below 1, the policy seeks to reduce case numbers to low levels or (as seen in previous outbreaks with severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) to eliminate human-to-human transmission.
zh: 通过针对再生数 (R) （每个病例产生的二代病例的平均数量）并将 R 降低至 1 以下，该政策试图将病例数量降至较低水平或（如先前的严重急性呼吸系统综合征和埃博拉病毒爆发）消除人传人现象。
pert_zh: 该政策试图通过针对再生数 (R) 并将 R 降低至 1 以下，将病例数量降至较低水平或（如先前的严重急性呼吸系统综合征和埃博拉病毒爆发）消除人传人现象，每个病例产生的二代病例的平均数量。
bt_pert_zh: The policy seeks to reduce the number of cases to a low level or (as in previous outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) eliminate human-to-human transmission by targeting the reproduction number (R) and reducing R to below 1, the average number of secondary cases generated by each case.

en: As the experience from the 2009 H1N1 pandemic has shown, NPIs can be a crucial component of pandemic mitigation.
zh: 2009 年 H1N1 疫情的经验已经证明，NPI 可能是缓解疫情的重要组成部分。
pert_zh: NPI 可能是缓解疫情的重要组成部分，2009 年 H1N1 疫情的经验已经证明。
bt_pert_zh: NPIs can be an important component of epidemic mitigation, as the experience with the 2009 H1N1 epidemic demonstrated.

en: Key to the focus of our study will be the estimation of peak cases in the population and continual monitoring by data collection and modelling the potential growth and emergence of subsequent peaks in new cases as social distancing measures are relaxed.
zh: 我们研究重点的关键将是估计人口中的峰值病例，通过数据采集进行持续监测，并对随着扩大社交距离措施的放松而可能出现的病例增长和后续高峰进行建模。
pert_zh: 我们研究重点的关键将是通过数据采集进行持续监测估计人口中的峰值病例，并对随着扩大社交距离措施的放松而可能出现的病例增长和后续高峰进行建模。
bt_pert_zh: Key to our research focus will be estimating peak cases in the population through ongoing surveillance through data collection, and modeling the growth and subsequent peaks in cases that may occur as social distancing measures are relaxed.

en: There has already been publication of important disease epidemiological measures concerning the outbreak of COVID-19 in mainland China.
zh: 关于中国大陆 COVID-19 爆发的重要疾病流行病学措施已经出版。
pert_zh: 重要的关于中国大陆 COVID-19 爆发的疾病流行病学措施已经出版。
bt_pert_zh: Important disease epidemiological measures regarding the COVID-19 outbreak in mainland China have been published.

en: A further fundamental measure in pandemic dynamics is the length of time from infection to when a person is infectious to others and the mean duration of infectiousness.
zh: 疫情动态的另一个基本指标是从一个人发生感染到传染给其他人的时间长度以及平均传染性持续时间。
pert_zh: 另一个基本指标是平均传染性持续时间以及从一个人感染到传染给其他人的时间长度，疫情动态的。
bt_pert_zh: Another basic indicator is the average duration of infectiousness and the length of time from when one person is infected to when they infect others, the dynamics of the epidemic.

en: These factors, if estimated accurately, will give good predictions for the likely length of the pandemic, the final number of infected cases.
zh: 如果能够准确估算这些因素，将对疫情可能持续的时间以及最终的感染病例数量给出合理的预测。
pert_zh: 将对疫情可能持续的时间以及最终的感染病例数量能够准确估算这些因素，给出合理的预测。
bt_pert_zh: These factors will be accurately estimated, and reasonable predictions will be made about how long the epidemic may last and the eventual number of infected cases.

en: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to (possibly spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic models.
zh: 我们打算将近似贝叶斯推断 (ABC) 应用于（可能在空间上存在异质性）“易感-暴露-传染-移出” (SEIR) 随机疫情模型。
pert_zh: 打算将近似贝叶斯推断 (ABC) 应用于（可能在空间上存在异质性）“易感-暴露-传染-移出” (SEIR) 随机疫情模型。
bt_pert_zh: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to a (potentially spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic model.

en: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many fields including disease transmission modelling.
zh: 此类技术是高度可并行的，并且已经成功地应用于许多领域，包括疾病传播建模。
pert_zh: 此类技术是高度可并行的，并且已经成功地应用于包括疾病传播建模在内的许多领域。
bt_pert_zh: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many areas including disease transmission modeling.

en: They are particularly suited to situations where likelihood functions are absent and where more traditional approaches such as Markov chain Monte Carlo are impractical.
zh: 它们特别适合于缺少似然函数且不适合使用诸如马尔可夫链蒙特卡洛等更传统方法的情况。
pert_zh: 特别适合于缺少似然函数且不适合使用诸如马尔可夫链蒙特卡洛等更传统方法的情况，它们。
bt_pert_zh: They are particularly suitable for situations where a likelihood function is missing and more traditional methods such as Markov Chain Monte Carlo are not suitable.

en: Such an approach has been demonstrated to work effectively on the ASPREN surveillance data, a network of sentinel GPs and nurse practitioners who report deidentified information on ILIs and other conditions, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observation process itself has been successfully addressed.
zh: 事实证明，这种方法可以有效地处理 ASPREN 监测数据，这是一个由预警 GP 和执业护士组成的网络，负责报告关于 ILI 和其他疾病的匿名信息，在这些情况下，诸如缺失数据等问题以及对观察过程本身进行建模的需求已经被成功解决。
pert_zh: 这是一个由预警 GP 和执业护士组成的网络，事实证明，这种方法可以有效地处理 ASPREN 监测数据，负责报告关于 ILI 和其他疾病的匿名信息，在这些情况下，诸如缺失数据等问题以及对观察过程本身进行建模的需求已经被成功解决。
bt_pert_zh: This approach has proven effective in processing ASPREN surveillance data, a network of alert GPs and practice nurses tasked with reporting anonymous information on ILI and other diseases, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observational process itself have been successfully addressed.

en: Furthermore, peaks in new cases have been estimated by distributional methods.
zh: 此外，已经通过分布方法估计了新发病例的高峰。
pert_zh: 已经通过分布方法估计了新发病例的高峰此外。
bt_pert_zh: The peak of new cases has been estimated using distribution methods.

en: Estimates of the parameters of the SEIR model are tractable on large data sets because of parallelizability, and these methods have been implemented in several R libraries; we intend to use the libraries ABSEIR (deposited on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) to estimate epidemic measures on a weekly basis.
zh: 由于可并行性，SEIR 模型参数的估计在大型数据集上易于处理，并且这些方法已经应用于多个 R 库；我们打算使用 ABSEIR 库（存储于 GitHub：https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj）和 abctools 库 (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) 每周估算一次疫情指标。
pert_zh: SEIR 模型参数的估计在大型数据集上易于处理，由于可并行性，并且这些方法已经应用于多个 R 库；每周，我们打算使用 ABSEIR 库（存储于 GitHub：https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj）和 abctools 库 (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) 估算一次疫情指标。
bt_pert_zh: Estimation of SEIR model parameters is tractable on large datasets due to parallelism, and these methods have been applied to several R libraries; each week, we intend to estimate epidemic indicators once using the ABSEIR library (stored on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and the abctools library (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4).

en: Since we are fitting an SIR-epidemic model in the ABC routine, we anticipate that our results will be robust against weekly case data containing relatively small counts.
zh: 由于我们在 ABC 例程中拟合了 SIR 疫情模型，因此我们预期分析结果对于包含相对较少数量的每周病例数据将是可靠的。
pert_zh: 由于我们在 ABC 例程中拟合了 SIR 疫情模型，因此我们预期分析结果对于包含每周病例数据相对较少的将是可靠的。
bt_pert_zh: Because we fit a SIR epidemic model in the ABC routine, we expect the analysis results to be robust to data containing relatively few weekly case data.

en: For example, see for the ABC methodology applied to the Tristan da Cunha common cold data from 1967, where counts of I (number of infectious cases) and R (number of recovered cases) are in the tens at most.
zh: 例如，ABC 方法已经应用于特里斯坦-达库尼亚群岛 1967 年以来的普通感冒数据，其中 I（感染病例数）和 R（恢复病例数）的计数最多为几十。
pert_zh: ABC 方法已经应用于特里斯坦-达库尼亚群岛 1967 年以来的普通感冒数据，其中 I（感染病例数）和 R（恢复病例数）的计数为几十最多。
bt_pert_zh: The ABC method has been applied to common cold data from Tristan da Cunha since 1967, where the counts of I (number of infected cases) and R (number of recovered cases) are in the tens at most.

en: Finally, in addition to the above methodology we will employ the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery) to estimate the case fatality ratio.
zh: 最后，除了上述方法学之外，我们还将采用具有两种结局（死亡和恢复）的 Kaplan-Meier 方法来估计病死率。
pert_zh: 除了上述方法学之外，最后，我们还将采用具有两种结局（死亡和恢复）的 Kaplan-Meier 方法来估计病死率。
bt_pert_zh: In addition to the above methodology, finally, we will estimate the case fatality rate using the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery).

en: This approach is independent of the ABC methodology and will allow comparisons between estimates from the two modelling approaches to judge robustness of results.
zh: 该方法独立于 ABC 方法学，将允许比较两种建模方法的估计值以判断结果的稳健性。
pert_zh: 该方法将允许比较两种建模方法的估计值以判断结果的稳健性，独立于 ABC 方法学。
bt_pert_zh: This approach will allow comparison of estimates from both modelling approaches to judge the robustness of the results, independent of the ABC methodology.

en: RCGP RSC’s surveillance with PHE is defined as Health Protection under Regulation 3 of The Health Service (Control of Patient Information) Regulations 2002.
zh: RCGP RSC 与 PHE 的监测在 2002 年《卫生服务（患者信息控制）条例》第 3 条中被定义为“健康保护”。
pert_zh: 2002 年《卫生服务（患者信息控制）条例》第 3 条中，RCGP RSC 与 PHE 的监测被定义为“健康保护”。
bt_pert_zh: Surveillance by the RCGP RSC and PHE is defined as ‘health protection’ in Regulation 3 of the Health Services (Control of Patient Information) Regulations 2002 .

en: This has been confirmed by PHE’s Caldicott Guardian’s Office.
zh: PHE 的卡尔迪科特监护人办公室已经证实了这一点。
pert_zh: 卡尔迪科特监护人办公室的 PHE 已经证实了这一点。
bt_pert_zh: This has been confirmed by PHE at the Caldicot Guardian’s Office.

en: We do not see any increased risk to practices or practitioners taking part in this surveillance.
zh: 我们认为参与此项监测计划对诊所或从业者没有增加任何风险。
pert_zh: 参与此项监测计划我们认为对诊所或从业者没有增加任何风险。
bt_pert_zh: We do not perceive any added risk to the clinic or practitioners by participating in this surveillance program.

en: Infection prevention and control advice will follow extant national guidance.
zh: 感染预防和控制建议将遵循现有的国家指南。
pert_zh: 现有的国家指南将被遵循感染预防和控制建议。
bt_pert_zh: Existing national guidance will be followed for infection prevention and control advice.

en: Any cases identified will be managed according to the PHE/NHS guidance in force at the time, including advice for identified contacts.
zh: 发现的所有病例都将根据当时有效的 PHE/NHS 指南进行管理，包括对已确定的密切接触者提供的建议。
pert_zh: 所有病例的管理都将根据当时有效的 PHE/NHS 指南进行，包括对已确定的密切接触者提供的建议。
bt_pert_zh: All cases will be managed in accordance with PHE/NHS guidance in force at the time, including advice for identified close contacts.

en: However, our training will include reminders about safe handling of specimens and revision of infection control measures anticipated to be high in our practices.
zh: 但是，我们的培训将包括预计在诊所中常用的有关标本安全处理以及感染控制措施修订的提醒。
pert_zh: 我们的培训将包括修订的提醒，预计在诊所中常用的关于标本安全处理以及感染控制措施。
bt_pert_zh: Our training will include revised reminders regarding safe specimen handling and infection control practices that are expected to be commonly used in the clinic.

en: It is a key part of Regulation 12 about safe care and treatment, periodically inspected by the Care Quality Commission.
zh: 这是关于安全护理和治疗的“12 号法规”的关键部分，由医疗质量委员会定期检查。
pert_zh: 由医疗质量委员会定期检查，这是关于安全护理和治疗的“12 号法规”的关键部分。
bt_pert_zh: Regular inspections by the Care Quality Commission are a key part of Regulation 12 on safe care and treatment.

en: Travel History and Clinical Descriptors of the COVID-19 Infections
zh: 旅行史以及 COVID-19 感染的临床描述
pert_zh: COVID-19 感染的临床描述以及旅行史
bt_pert_zh: Clinical Description of COVID-19 Infection and Travel History

en: The RCGP RSC practices have been advised on the clinical coding that has been made available for COVID-19 across all CMR systems.
zh: 已经对 RCGP RSC 诊所提出了有关所有 CMR 系统中可用于 COVID-19 的临床编码的建议。
pert_zh: 已经对 RCGP RSC 诊所提出了有关所有可用于 COVID-19 的临床编码的 CMR 系统的建议。
bt_pert_zh: Advice has been given to RCGP RSC clinics regarding the CMR system for all clinical coding available for COVID-19.

en: This includes information on coding of clinical descriptors (Table 4) and any recent travel history.
zh: 这包括有关临床描述符编码（表 4）和任何近期旅行史的信息。
pert_zh: 包括任何近期旅行史的信息和有关临床描述符编码（表 4）的。
bt_pert_zh: Include information on any recent travel history and relevant clinical descriptor codes ( Table 4 ).

en: Establishment of Extended Virology Sampling
zh: 建立扩展病毒学采样
pert_zh: 建立扩展采样病毒学
bt_pert_zh: Establishing Extended Sampling Virology

en: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of LRTI.
zh: 参与年度流感病毒学监测的 RCGP RSC 诊所已经开始从存在 LRTI 症状的患者中取样。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 诊所已经开始从存在 LRTI 症状的患者中取样参与年度流感病毒学监测。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC clinic has begun taking samples from patients with LRTI symptoms to participate in annual influenza virology surveillance.

en: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
zh: 收到的所有样本正在进行流感和 COVID-19 检测。
pert_zh: 所有样本收到的正在进行流感和COVID-19检测。
bt_pert_zh: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.

en: This has led to initial early identification of background spread in low-risk patients.
zh: 这导致开始早期发现低危患者的背景扩散。
pert_zh: 这导致背景扩散开始早期发现低危患者。
bt_pert_zh: This leads to early detection of low-risk patients with background diffusion onset.

en: As of March 7, 2020, the surveillance system has detected 2 cases of COVID-19 in low-risk patients with no history of travel through extended virological sampling.
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 7 日，监测系统已经通过扩展病毒学采样在没有旅行史的低危患者中检测到 2 名 COVID-19 病例。
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月 7 日，监测系统已经在没有旅行史的低危患者中通过扩展病毒学采样检测到 2 名 COVID-19 病例。
bt_pert_zh: As of March 7, 2020, the surveillance system has detected 2 cases of COVID-19 through expanded virologic sampling in low-risk patients with no travel history.

en: This protocol describes how we have adapted a national influenza surveillance system to monitor community spread of an unexpected infection of COVID-19.
zh: 该方案描述了我们如何调整全国性流感监测系统以监控意外 COVID-19 感染的社区扩散。
pert_zh: 该方案描述了我们如何调整全国性流感监测系统以监控 COVID-19 感染的社区扩散的意外。
bt_pert_zh: This scenario describes how we can adapt our national influenza surveillance system to monitor for unexpected community spread of COVID-19 infection.

en: We have rapidly created and incorporated new codes to allow data recording, and are collecting data to monitor the effectiveness of containment strategies.
zh: 我们已经快速创建并合并了新的编码以允许进行数据记录，并正在收集数据以监控控制策略的有效性。
pert_zh: 已经快速创建并合并了新的编码，以允许进行数据记录，并正在收集数据以监控控制策略的有效性。
bt_pert_zh: New coding has been rapidly created and incorporated to allow for data logging, and data is being collected to monitor the effectiveness of control strategies.

en: Through this surveillance, we intend to find out more about the epidemiology of COVID-19 in ambulatory care.
zh: 通过这种监测，我们打算找到更多门诊医疗中的 COVID-19 流行病学信息。
pert_zh: 通过这种监测，我们打算找到 COVID-19 在门诊医疗中更多的流行病学信息。
bt_pert_zh: Through this surveillance, we intend to find out more epidemiological information about COVID-19 in outpatient care.

en: In particular, its rate of spread, both temporal and geographical.
zh: 具体而言，是疫情扩散速度，包括时间和地域方面。
pert_zh: 具体而言，包括时间和地域方面的疫情扩散速度。
bt_pert_zh: Specifically, it includes the speed of the spread of the epidemic in terms of time and region.

en: Our testing of low-risk patients will also inform whether the containment strategy that is based on virology testing of high-risk patients and their contacts plus self-isolation is effective.
zh: 我们对低危患者的检测还将了解基于对高危患者及其接触者进行病毒学检测外加自我隔离的控制策略是否有效。
pert_zh: 对低危患者的检测还将了解基于对高危患者及其接触者进行病毒学检测外加自我隔离的控制策略是否有效。
bt_pert_zh: Testing of low-risk patients will also inform whether control strategies based on virological testing of high-risk patients and their contacts plus self-isolation are effective.

en: Containment should slow the spread, and there may be benefits in the management of spread from intense surveillance.
zh: 控制措施应该会减慢疫情扩散速度，严格监测可能有利于控制疫情扩散。
pert_zh: 严格监测可能有利于控制疫情扩散，控制措施应该会减慢疫情扩散速度。
bt_pert_zh: Strict monitoring may help control the spread of the epidemic, and control measures should slow the spread of the epidemic.

en: However, there may come a point at which the virus spreads more widely into the population, as has happened in Italy.
zh: 但是，就像在意大利发生过的那样，可能会达到一个病毒更广泛传播到人群中的时间点。
pert_zh: 就像在意大利发生过的那样，可能会达到一个更广泛传播到人群中的时间点病毒。
bt_pert_zh: As has happened in Italy, there may be a point at which the virus spreads more widely among the population.

en: Surveillance of low-risk patients should inform when we reach this tipping point and when infection rates start to remit.
zh: 低危患者的监测应该能够告知我们何时达到这个临界点以及感染率何时开始降低。
pert_zh: 监测低危患者应该能够告知我们何时达到这个临界点以及感染率何时开始降低。
bt_pert_zh: Monitoring low-risk patients should be able to tell us when this tipping point is reached and when infection rates begin to decline.

en: The epidemiology of COVID-19 remains emergent.
zh: COVID-19 的流行病学仍然处于发展初期。
pert_zh: COVID-19 的流行病学仍然处于发展初期。
bt_pert_zh: The epidemiology of COVID-19 is still in its early stages of development.

en: The registration-based nature of UK primary care means that we will be able to create a complete picture of the cumulative incidence and duration.
zh: 英国基层医疗的登记制度意味着我们将能够对累积发病率和持续时间进行全面了解。
pert_zh: 英国基层医疗的登记制度意味着我们将能够对累积发病率和持续时间进行全面了解。
bt_pert_zh: The UK primary care register system means we will be able to gain a comprehensive picture of the cumulative incidence and duration.

en: The surveillance system should be able to identify areas where COVID-19 spread is taking place that might be suitable for trials of antiviral therapy.
zh: 监测系统应该能够确定正在发生 COVID-19 传播的区域，这些区域可能适合进行抗病毒治疗试验。
pert_zh: 这些区域可能适合进行抗病毒治疗试验，监测系统应该能够确定正在发生 COVID-19 传播的区域。
bt_pert_zh: These areas may be suitable for trials of antiviral treatments, and surveillance systems should be able to identify areas where COVID-19 transmission is occurring.

en: We could also follow up on the effectiveness or any adverse reactions to these medicines or vaccinations.
zh: 我们还可以跟踪这些药物或疫苗接种的有效性或任何不良反应。
pert_zh: 我们还可以跟踪这些药物或疫苗接种的有效性或任何不良反应。
bt_pert_zh: We can also track the effectiveness of these medicines or vaccinations or any adverse reactions.

en: Finally, early detection of a confirmed COVID-19 case has exemplified the rapid implementation of this enhanced surveillance in the national network.
zh: 最后，一名确诊 COVID-19 病例的早期检测已经证明在全国性网络中快速实施这种增强监测方案的价值。
pert_zh: 最后，在全国性网络中快速实施这种增强监测方案的价值已经证明，一名确诊 COVID-19 病例的早期检测。
bt_pert_zh: Finally, the value of rapidly implementing this enhanced surveillance program across a national network has been demonstrated with the early detection of one confirmed COVID-19 case.

en: Safety of practices is our primary concern.
zh: 诊所的安全性是我们首要考虑的问题。
pert_zh: 我们首要考虑的问题是诊所的安全性。
bt_pert_zh: Our primary concern is the safety of the clinic.

en: The RCGP RSC has operated for over 50 years and has been involved in collecting samples to monitor disease and vaccine effectiveness through the Hong Kong flu pandemic of 1968/69, the Russian flu of 1977/78, and the 2009 Swine flu pandemic.
zh: RCGP RSC 已经运行了 50 多年，并且在 1968/69 年的香港流感疫情、1977/78 年的俄罗斯流感疫情以及 2009 年的猪流感疫情期间参与了样本采集以监测疾病和疫苗有效性。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 已经运行了 50 多年，并且在 1968/69 年的香港流感疫情、1977/78 年的俄罗斯流感疫情以及 2009 年的猪流感疫情期间参与了样本采集以监测疾病和疫苗有效性。
bt_pert_zh: The RCGP RSC has been operating for over 50 years and was involved in collecting samples to monitor disease and vaccine effectiveness during the 1968/69 Hong Kong flu epidemic, the 1977/78 Russian flu epidemic and the 2009 swine flu epidemic.

en: We are not aware of any increased risk to practice staff or other patients from involvement in surveillance.
zh: 我们不知道参与监测的诊所工作人员或其他患者的风险是否会增加。
pert_zh: 我们不知道参与监测的其他患者或诊所工作人员的风险是否会增加。
bt_pert_zh: We do not know if there is an increased risk to other patients or clinic staff involved in surveillance.

en: Pandemic preparedness is part of the role of the RCGP RSC.
zh: 疫情防范是 RCGP RSC 职能的一部分。
pert_zh: RCGP RSC 职能的一部分是疫情防范。
bt_pert_zh: Part of the RCGP RSC’s remit is outbreak preparedness.

en: It is plausible that enhanced coding of information from contacts with the practices in RCGP RSC will reduce the likelihood of people who may be suspected COVID-19 cases being brought to the surgery inadvertently.
zh: 对从与 RCGP RSC 诊所的联系人获得的信息进行增强编码似乎有望减少可能为疑似 COVID-19 病例的患者被误带入诊室的可能性。
pert_zh: 增强编码对从与 RCGP RSC 诊所的联系人获得的信息进行的是有望减少可能为疑似 COVID-19 病例的患者被误带入诊室的可能性。
bt_pert_zh: Enhanced coding of information obtained from contacts with RCGP RSC clinics will hopefully reduce the likelihood of patients who may be suspected COVID-19 cases being mistakenly brought into the clinic.

en: Where cases are detected unexpectedly, it is probably helpful for that patient, their contacts, and the practice to know.
zh: 在意外发现病例的情况下，对患者、其密切接触者和诊所可能会有所帮助。
pert_zh: 对患者、其密切接触者和诊所在意外发现病例的情况下可能会有所帮助。
bt_pert_zh: It may be helpful to patients, their close contacts, and clinics in case of accidental case detection.

en: The impact on practices has been to close for a day, if a case is found, for deep cleaning and then reopen.
zh: 对诊所的影响是，如果发现病例，需要关闭一天，在进行深度消毒后重新开放。
pert_zh: 如果发现病例，对诊所的影响是需要关闭一天，在进行深度消毒后重新开放。
bt_pert_zh: If a case is found, the impact on the clinic is that it will need to be closed for one day and reopen after deep disinfection.

en: The principal limitations of our system are the number of data points.
zh: 我们系统的主要限制是数据点的数量。
pert_zh: 数据点的数量是我们系统的主要限制。
bt_pert_zh: The number of data points is the main limitation of our system.

en: We are collecting serology and virology data from 100 sites, which covers a small group of the population.
zh: 我们正在从覆盖一小部分人口的 100 个研究中心采集血清学和病毒学数据。
pert_zh: 正在从覆盖一小部分人口的 100 个研究中心采集血清学和病毒学数据。
bt_pert_zh: Serological and virological data are being collected from 100 research centers covering a small portion of the population.

en: This has been satisfactory for monitoring influenza, but we are not certain if this is a sufficiently large sample for the COVID-19 outbreak.
zh: 这对于流感监控而言已经令人满意，但我们不确定这些样本的数量是否足够用于监测 COVID-19 爆发。
pert_zh: 但我们不确定这些样本的数量是否足够用于监测 COVID-19 爆发，这对于流感监控而言已经令人满意。
bt_pert_zh: But we are not sure whether the number of these samples is sufficient for monitoring COVID-19 outbreaks, which is satisfactory for influenza surveillance.

en: Our sites (surveillance practices) are currently fixed, and it could be helpful to be able to rapidly onboard practices in regions where there are more cases.
zh: 我们的研究中心（监测诊所）目前是固定的，能够在具有更多病例的地区迅速启用更多诊所可能会有所帮助。
pert_zh: 我们的研究中心（监测诊所）目前是固定的，能够在具有更多病例的地区迅速启用更多诊所可能会有所帮助。更多诊所可能会有所帮助，我们的研究中心（监测诊所）目前是固定的，能够在具有更多病例的地区迅速启用。
bt_pert_zh: Our research centers (surveillance clinics) are currently fixed and being able to quickly open more clinics in areas with more cases may help. More clinics may help, our research centers (surveillance clinics) are currently fixed and being able to quickly open more clinics in areas with more cases.

en: Currently, we will be reporting weekly.
zh: 目前，我们将每周报告一次。
pert_zh: 每周我们将目前报告一次。
bt_pert_zh: We will report on the current situation once a week.

en: Our existing system can be enhanced to twice weekly, but maybe daily or hourly data should be our current approach.
zh: 我们现有的系统可以提高到每周两次，但也许每天或每小时数据应该成为我们当前的方法。
pert_zh: 也许每天或每小时数据应该成为我们当前的方法，但我们现有的系统可以提高到每周两次。
bt_pert_zh: Perhaps daily or hourly data should be our current approach, but our current system could be improved to twice weekly.

en: Opportunistic sampling for serology in children younger than 10 years might be limited due to the overall reduced rate of blood tests in children.
zh: 由于儿童的总体血液检测率较低，10 岁以下儿童的血清学采样机会可能会受到限制。
pert_zh: 由于血液检测率较低，10岁以下儿童的血清学采样机会可能会受到限制。
bt_pert_zh: Opportunities for serological sampling may be limited in children younger than 10 years of age due to low blood testing rates.

en: The extended surveillance using the RCGP RSC-PHE network for the emergent COVID-19 outbreak has been established rapidly.
zh: 已经快速建立了使用 RCGP RSC-PHE 网络对处于发展初期的 COVID-19 爆发进行扩展监测的方案。
pert_zh: 已经快速建立了使用 RCGP RSC-PHE 网络对 COVID-19 爆发处于发展初期进行扩展监测的方案。
bt_pert_zh: Protocols for extended surveillance of the COVID-19 outbreak in its early stages of development have been rapidly established using the RCGP RSC-PHE network.

en: The model of getting the appropriate informatics to enable capture of the required data has already been a success, with data recording starting the week the codes were created.
zh: 获取适当信息以支持采集必需数据的模型已经取得成功，从创建编码的那一周开始记录数据。
pert_zh: 从创建编码的那一周开始记录数据，获取适当信息以支持采集必需数据的模型已经取得成功。
bt_pert_zh: The model of recording data beginning the week the code was created and obtaining appropriate information to support the collection of necessary data has been successful.

en: In addition, modifying the existing surveillance system to collect population data in a parallel way has also been effective.
zh: 此外，修改现有监测系统以并行方式采集人口数据也很有效。
pert_zh: 修改现有监测系统以并行方式采集人口数据也很有效，此外。
bt_pert_zh: Modifying existing surveillance systems to collect population data in parallel is also effective.

en: However, we are at present unsure as to whether the scale of this surveillance provides sufficient data to drive local containment strategies or if reporting infrequently meets the need of our information age.
zh: 但是，我们目前尚不确定这种监测规模能否提供足够的数据来推动当地控制策略，或者较低频率的报告是否符合我们信息时代的需要。
pert_zh: 目前尚不确定这种监测规模能否提供足够的数据来推动当地控制策略，或者较低频率的报告是否符合我们信息时代的需要，但是。
bt_pert_zh: It is uncertain whether this scale of surveillance will provide sufficient data to drive local control strategies, or whether less frequent reporting is consistent with the needs of our information age, however.

en: National Basketball Association suspends season due to COVID-19 concerns

en: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19.

en: The NBA's decision followed a Utah Jazz player testing positive for the COVID-19 virus.

bt_pert_zh: The NBA said the player was not at Chesapeake Energy Arena in Oklahoma City, where the Utah Jazz will play the Oklahoma City Thunder.

en: On Friday, United States President Donald Trump declared a national emergency in response to the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.
zh: 星期五，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普宣布了国家紧急状态，以应对不断蔓延的冠状病毒爆发。

bt_pert_zh: U.S. President Donald Trump declared a national emergency on Friday in response to the spreading coronavirus outbreak.

en: The move came two days after the World Health Organization declared the outbreak, which causes the COVID-19 disease, to be a pandemic.
zh: 该举措是在世界卫生组织宣布导致COVID-19疾病的病毒爆发为大流行后两天做出的。
pert_zh: 在世界卫生组织宣布导致COVID-19疾病的病毒爆发为大流行后两天做出的是该举措。
bt_pert_zh: The move comes two days after the World Health Organization declared the outbreak of the virus that causes the COVID-19 disease a pandemic.

en: The move gives the federal government access to around US$50 billion in extra funding to combat the pandemic, according to NBC News.
zh: 据NBC新闻报道，该举措让联邦政府获权启动约500亿美元的额外资金，来应对该大流行。
pert_zh: 据NBC新闻报道，该举措让联邦政府获权启动额外500亿美元的资金，来应对该大流行。
bt_pert_zh: The move gives the federal government the authority to activate an additional $50 billion in funding to respond to the pandemic, NBC News reported.

en: The proclamation specifically said "the COVID-19 outbreak in the United States constitutes a national emergency" and said the national emergency began on March 1, almost two weeks before the proclamation itself.
zh: 公告特别指出“美国爆发COVID-19导致了国家紧急状态”，并表示国家紧急状态已于3月1日开始，比公告本身早两周。
pert_zh: 特别指出的公告显示，“美国爆发COVID-19导致了国家紧急状态”，国家紧急状态已于3月1日开始，比公告本身早两周。
bt_pert_zh: The proclamation specifically noted that "there has been a national emergency due to the outbreak of COVID-19 in the United States," and that the national emergency began on March 1, two weeks earlier than the proclamation itself.

en: The United States Department of Health and Human Services declared the outbreak a "public health emergency" on January 31.
zh: 1月31日，美国卫生与公共服务部宣布此次爆发为“公共卫生紧急事件”。
pert_zh: 美国卫生与公共服务部在1月31日宣布此次爆发为“公共卫生紧急事件”。
bt_pert_zh: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services declared the outbreak a "public health emergency" on January 31.

en: Trump did not place the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) in charge of the government's response to COVID-19, which Politico reported left some experts in disaster management disappointed.
zh: 特朗普并没有让联邦应急管理局(FEMA)来负责政府对COVID-19的应对工作，据Politico报道，这让部分灾难管理专家感到失望。
pert_zh: 据Politico报道，特朗普并没有让联邦应急管理局(FEMA)来负责政府对COVID-19的应对工作，这让部分灾难管理专家感到失望。
bt_pert_zh: According to Politico, Trump did not put the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) in charge of the government's response to COVID-19, which disappointed some disaster management experts.

en: Politico quoted Tim Manning, formerly a deputy administrator at FEMA, as saying "FEMA has an important role in coordinating the larger response to the crisis" and "[i]f there's an emergency, FEMA needs to be involved."
zh: Politico援引FEMA前副局长Tim Manning的话表示，“FEMA在协调更大的危机应对行动方面发挥着重要作用”，“[如果]出现紧急情况，FEMA需要介入。”
pert_zh: Politico援引FEMA前副局长Tim Manning的话表示，“FEMA在协调更大的危机应对行动方面发挥着重要作用”，“[如果]FEMA需要介入，出现紧急情况”。
bt_pert_zh: Politico quoted former FEMA deputy administrator Tim Manning as saying that "FEMA plays an important role in coordinating the larger crisis response" and "[if] there's an emergency and FEMA needs to step in."

en: Trump made the decision under provisions of the National Emergencies Act, amongst other governing authorities.
zh: 特朗普是根据《国家紧急状态法案》以及其他监管机构的规定做出这一决定的。
pert_zh: 特朗普是以及其他监管机构的规定根据《国家紧急状态法案》做出这一决定的。
bt_pert_zh: Trump made the decision under the National Emergencies Act, along with other regulatory agencies.

en: The Trump administration also announced other efforts in response to COVID-19, including waiving the interest it collects on federal student loans and increasing U.S. strategic oil reserve oil purchases.
zh: 特朗普政府还宣布了应对COVID-19的其他举措，包括免除联邦学生贷款的利息以及增加购买美国战略石油储备油。
pert_zh: 特朗普政府还宣布了其他应对COVID-19的举措，包括增加购买美国战略石油储备油以及免除联邦学生贷款的利息。
bt_pert_zh: The Trump administration also announced other measures to respond to COVID-19, including increased purchases of oil for the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve and waiver of interest on federal student loans.

en: Impact of the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic on education
zh: 2019-20冠状病毒疫情对教育的影响
pert_zh: 对教育的影响2019-20冠状病毒疫情
bt_pert_zh: Impact of the 2019-20 Coronavirus Pandemic on Education

en: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic has affected educational systems worldwide, leading to the widespread closures of schools and universities.
zh: 2019-20冠状病毒疫情已经影响了全球教育系统，导致中小学和大学普遍关闭。
pert_zh: 2019-20冠状病毒疫情已经影响了全球教育系统，导致中小学和大学普遍关闭。
bt_pert_zh: The 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic has impacted education systems around the world, leading to widespread closures of schools and universities.

en: As of 8 April 2020, approximately 1.716 billion learners have been affected due to school closures in response to COVID-19.
zh: 截止到2020年4月8日，约有17.16亿学生由于学校为应对COVID-19而关闭的举措受到影响。
pert_zh: 约有17.16亿学生由于学校为应对COVID-19而关闭的举措受到影响，截止到2020年4月8日。
bt_pert_zh: Approximately 1.716 billion students were affected by school closures in response to COVID-19 as of April 8, 2020.

en: According to UNESCO monitoring, 188 countries have implemented nationwide closures and 5 have implemented local closures, impacting about 99.4%  of the world's student population.
zh: 联合国教科文组织的监控结果显示，188个国家/地区已实行全国范围的关闭举措，5个国家/地区实行了地区性关闭，这影响到全球大约99.4%的学生。
pert_zh: 联合国教科文组织的监控结果显示，5个国家/地区实行了地区性关闭，188个国家/地区已实行全国范围的关闭举措，这影响到全球大约99.4%的学生。
bt_pert_zh: UNESCO's monitoring results show that 5 countries have implemented regional closures and 188 countries have implemented national closure measures, affecting approximately 99.4% of students worldwide.

en: On 23 March 2020, Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) released a statement announcing the cancellation of Cambridge IGCSE, Cambridge O Level, Cambridge International AS & A Level, Cambridge AICE Diploma, and Cambridge Pre-U examinations for the May/June 2020 series across all countries.
zh: 2020年3月23日，剑桥国际考试委员会(CIE)发布了一项声明，宣布取消所有国家/地区2020年5月/6月的系列考试，包括Cambridge IGCSE、Cambridge O Level、Cambridge International AS & A Level、Cambridge AICE Diploma和Cambridge Pre-U。
pert_zh: 剑桥国际考试委员会(CIE)在2020年3月23日发布了一项声明，宣布取消了包括Cambridge IGCSE、Cambridge O Level、Cambridge International AS & A Level、Cambridge AICE Diploma和Cambridge Pre-U在内的所有国家/地区2020年5月/6月的系列考试。
bt_pert_zh: Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) issued a statement on 23 March 2020 announcing the cancellation of all May/June 2020 examination series for all countries including Cambridge IGCSE, Cambridge O Level, Cambridge International AS & A Level, Cambridge AICE Diploma and Cambridge Pre-U.

en: International Baccalaureate exams have also been cancelled.School closures impact not only students, teachers, and families, but have far-reaching economic and societal consequences.
zh: 国际文凭组织的考试也已取消。学校关闭不仅会影响学生、教师和家庭，还会产生深远的经济和社会后果。
pert_zh: 国际文凭组织的考试也已取消。不仅会影响学生、教师和家庭，学校关闭还会产生深远的经济和社会后果。
bt_pert_zh: International Baccalaureate exams have also been cancelled. As well as affecting students, teachers and families, school closures will have far-reaching economic and social consequences.

en: School closures in response to COVID-19 have shed light on various social and economic issues, including student debt, digital learning, food insecurity, and homelessness, as well as access to childcare, health care, housing, internet, and disability services.
zh: 为应对COVID-19而关闭学校反映出各种社会和经济问题，包括学生贷款、数字化学习、食品安全和无家可归问题，以及儿童保育、医疗保健、住房、互联网和残障人士服务的提供情况。
pert_zh: 关闭学校为应对COVID-19反映出各种社会和经济问题，包括学生贷款、数字化学习、食品安全和无家可归问题，以及儿童保育、医疗保健、住房、互联网和残障人士服务的提供情况。
bt_pert_zh: School closures in response to COVID-19 reflect a variety of social and economic issues, including student debt, digital learning, food insecurity and homelessness, and the provision of child care, health care, housing, internet, and disability services.

en: The impact was more severe for disadvantaged children and their families, causing interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems, and consequent economic cost to families who could not work.In response to school closures, UNESCO recommended the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.
zh: 该影响对于弱势儿童和他们的家庭更为严重，导致学习中断、营养不良、儿童保育问题，以及由此给无法工作的家庭带来的经济损失。为了应对学校关闭，联合国教科文组织建议使用远程学习课程以及开放式教育应用程序和平台，供学校和教师用来远程联系学生，缓解教育中断情况。
pert_zh: 对于弱势儿童和他们的家庭，该影响更为严重，导致学习中断、营养不良、儿童保育问题，以及由此给无法工作的家庭带来的经济损失。为了应对学校关闭，联合国教科文组织建议使用远程学习课程以及开放式教育应用程序和平台，供学校和教师用来远程联系学生，缓解教育中断情况。
bt_pert_zh: The impact is even more severe for vulnerable children and their families, leading to disruptions in learning, malnutrition, childcare issues, and resulting economic losses for families who are unable to work. In response to school closures, UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning courses and open education applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to connect with students remotely and mitigate educational disruptions.

en: Efforts to stem the spread of COVID-19 through non-pharmaceutical interventions and preventive measures such as social-distancing and self-isolation have prompted the widespread closure of primary, secondary, and tertiary schooling in over 100 countries.Previous outbreaks of infectious diseases have prompted widespread school closings around the world, with varying levels of effectiveness.
zh: 通过非药物干预以及保持社交距离和自我隔离等预防性措施来阻止COVID-19扩散的举措导致超过100个国家/地区的小学、中学和高校普遍关闭。以前爆发的传染性疾病曾导致全球学校普遍关闭，并且该关闭举措取得了不同程度的成效。
pert_zh: 导致小学、中学和高校在超过100个国家/地区普遍关闭的举措包括通过非药物干预以及保持社交距离和自我隔离等预防性措施。以前爆发的传染性疾病曾导致全球学校普遍关闭，并且该关闭举措取得了不同程度的成效。
bt_pert_zh: The widespread closure of primary, secondary and higher education schools in more than 100 countries has included non-pharmaceutical interventions and preventive measures such as social distancing and self-isolation. Previous outbreaks of infectious diseases have led to widespread school closures around the world with varying degrees of success.

en: Mathematical modelling has shown that transmission of an outbreak may be delayed by closing schools.
zh: 数学建模显示，关闭学校可能会延缓病毒爆发所导致的传染。
pert_zh: 数学建模显示，关闭学校可能会延缓传染所导致的病毒爆发。
bt_pert_zh: Mathematical modelling suggests that closing schools could slow the spread of the virus.

en: However, effectiveness depends on the contacts children maintain outside of school.
zh: 然而，效果取决于学生在校外的社交接触。
pert_zh: 效果取决于学生在校外的社交接触，然而。
bt_pert_zh: The effectiveness depends on students' social contacts outside of school, however.

en: School closures may be effective when enacted promptly.
zh: 快速实施关闭学校的举措可能会有效。
pert_zh: 关闭学校的快速实施举措可能会有效。
bt_pert_zh: The quick implementation of school closures could be effective.

en: If school closures occur late relative to an outbreak, they are less effective and may not have any impact at all.
zh: 如果病毒爆发以后才迟迟关闭学校，则效果会大打折扣，甚至完全无效。
pert_zh: 如果病毒爆发以后才迟迟关闭学校，则效果会大打折扣，甚至完全无效。
bt_pert_zh: If schools are closed too late after the virus outbreak, the effect will be greatly reduced or even completely ineffective.

en: Additionally, in some cases, the reopening of schools after a period of closure has resulted in increased infection rates.
zh: 另外，在一些案例中，学校关闭一段时间后重新开学导致了感染率增加。
pert_zh: 在一些案例中，学校关闭一段时间后重新开学导致了感染率增加。
bt_pert_zh: In some cases, reopening schools after a period of closure has led to an increase in infection rates.

en: As closures tend to occur concurrently with other interventions such as public gathering bans, it can be difficult to measure the specific impact of school closures.During the 1918-1919 influenza pandemic in the United States, school closures and public gathering bans were associated with lower total mortality rates.
zh: 由于关闭往往与禁止公共聚会等其他干预措施同时实施，因此很难衡量关闭学校的具体影响。1918-1919年流感在美国大流行期间，学校关闭和公共聚会禁令降低了总死亡率。
pert_zh: 因此很难衡量关闭学校的具体影响，由于关闭往往与禁止公共聚会等其他干预措施同时实施。1918-1919年流感在美国大流行期间，学校关闭和公共聚会禁令降低了总死亡率。
bt_pert_zh: It is therefore difficult to measure the specific impact of school closures, as they are often implemented in conjunction with other interventions such as bans on public gatherings. During the 1918-1919 influenza pandemic in the United States, school closures and bans on public gatherings reduced overall mortality.

en: Cities that implemented such interventions earlier had greater delays in reaching peak mortality rates.
zh: 较早实施此类干预措施的城市大大延缓了死亡率高峰的到来。
pert_zh: 较早实施此类干预措施的城市大大延缓了死亡率高峰的到来。
bt_pert_zh: Cities that implemented such interventions earlier significantly delayed the peak in mortality rates.

en: Schools closed for a median duration of 4 weeks according to a study of 43 US cities' response to the Spanish Flu.
zh: 根据一项针对美国43个城市应对西班牙流感的研究，学校关闭的平均持续时间为4周。
pert_zh: 学校关闭的平均持续时间为4周，根据一项针对美国43个城市应对西班牙流感的研究。
bt_pert_zh: The average duration of school closures was four weeks, according to a study of 43 U.S. cities’ responses to the Spanish flu.

en: School closures were shown to reduce morbidity from the Asian flu by 90% during the 1957–58 outbreak, and up to 50% in controlling influenza in the US, 2004–2008.Multiple countries successfully slowed the spread of infection through school closures during the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
zh: 在1957-1958年的亚洲流感爆发期间，美国通过学校关闭举措使发病率降低了90%；2004-2008年期间，该举措将流感发病率降低了50%。在2009年H1N1流感期间，多个国家/地区都实施了学校关闭政策，成功地减缓了传染病的扩散。
pert_zh: 在1957-1958年的亚洲流感爆发期间，美国通过学校关闭举措使发病率降低了90%；2004-2008年期间，该举措将流感发病率降低了50%。在2009年H1N1流感期间，多个国家/地区都实施了学校关闭政策，成功地减缓了传染病的扩散。
bt_pert_zh: During the 1957-1958 Asian flu outbreak, school closures in the United States reduced cases by 90% and during 2004-2008, they reduced flu cases by 50%. During the 2009 H1N1 flu outbreak, several countries implemented school closures, which successfully slowed the spread of the infectious disease.

en: School closures in the city of Oita, Japan, were found to have successfully decreased the number of infected students at the peak of infection; however closing schools was not found to have significantly decreased the total number of infected students.
zh: 据发现，日本大分市的学校关闭举措成功降低了感染高峰期的感染学生人数；但未发现关闭学校显著降低感染学生的总人数。
pert_zh: 未发现关闭学校显著降低感染学生的总人数，据发现，日本大分市的学校关闭举措成功降低了感染高峰期的感染学生人数。
bt_pert_zh: School closures were not found to significantly reduce the total number of infected students, but school closures in Oita, Japan were found to successfully reduce the number of infected students during the peak period of infection.

en: Mandatory school closures and other social distancing measures were associated with a 29% to 37% reduction in influenza transmission rates.
zh: 强制关闭学校和其他保持社交距离的措施使流感传染速度降低了29%至37%。
pert_zh: 强制关闭学校和其他保持社交距离的措施使流感传染速度降低了29%至37%。
bt_pert_zh: Mandatory school closures and other social distancing measures reduced flu transmission by 29% to 37%.

en: Early school closures in the United States delayed the peak of the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.
zh: 美国及早实行的学校关闭措施延缓了2009年H1N1流感大流行高峰期的到来。
pert_zh: 2009年H1N1流感大流行高峰期的到来被延缓了，美国及早实行的学校关闭措施。
bt_pert_zh: The peak of the 2009 H1N1 influenza pandemic was delayed by early school closures in the United States.

en: Despite the overall success of closing schools, a study of school closures in Michigan found that "district level reactive school closures were ineffective."During the swine flu outbreak in 2009 in the UK, in an article titled "Closure of schools during an influenza pandemic" published in the Lancet Infectious Diseases, a group of epidemiologists endorsed the closure of schools in order to interrupt the course of the infection, slow further spread and buy time to research and produce a vaccine.
zh: 尽管关闭学校举措在总体上是成功的，但一项针对密歇根州学校关闭举措的研究显示，“地区级别的被动关闭学校没有效果”。根据《柳叶刀传染性疾病》上发表的一篇标题为《流感大流行期间的学校关闭措施》的文章所述，在2009年英国猪流感爆发期间，一些流行病学专家都赞成关闭学校，以切断感染过程、减慢病毒进一步扩散，并为研发和生产疫苗赢得时间。
pert_zh: 虽然关闭学校举措在总体上是成功的，但一项针对密歇根州学校关闭举措的研究显示，“地区级别的被动关闭学校没有效果”。在2009年英国猪流感爆发期间，一篇标题为《流感大流行期间的学校关闭措施》的文章所述，一些流行病学专家都赞成关闭学校，以切断感染过程、减慢病毒进一步扩散，并为研发和生产疫苗赢得时间。
bt_pert_zh: While school closures have been successful overall, a study of school closures in Michigan showed that "reactive closures at the district level were ineffective." During the 2009 British swine flu outbreak, an article titled "School Closures During Influenza Pandemics" stated that some epidemiologists favored closing schools to interrupt the infection process, slow the further spread of the virus, and buy time for the development and production of vaccines.

en: Having studied previous influenza pandemics including the 1918 flu pandemic, the influenza pandemic of 1957 and the 1968 flu pandemic, they reported on the economic and workforce effect school closure would have, particularly with a large percentage of doctors and nurses being women, of whom half had children under the age of 16.
zh: 在对以往的流感大流行（包括1918年流感大流行、1957年流感大流行和1968年流感大流行）进行研究后，他们报道了学校关闭对经济和劳动力造成的影响，特别是在医生和护士中，女性占较大比例，而且其中半数有不满16周岁的子女。
pert_zh: 在对以往的流感大流行（包括1918年流感大流行、1957年流感大流行和1968年流感大流行）进行研究后，他们报道了学校关闭对经济和劳动力造成的影响，特别是在医生和护士中，女性占较大比例，而且其中有半数不满16周岁的子女。
bt_pert_zh: Looking at previous flu pandemics, including the 1918 pandemic, the 1957 pandemic and the 1968 pandemic, they report the economic and workforce impacts of school closures, particularly among doctors and nurses, who are disproportionately represented among women and half of whom have children under the age of 16.

en: They also looked at the dynamics of the spread of influenza in France during French school holidays and noted that cases of flu dropped when schools closed and re-emerged when they re-opened.
zh: 他们还研究了在法国学校放假期间，法国流感扩散的动态趋势，并注意到在学校关闭期间，流感病例数下降，而在学校重新开学后，病例数反弹。
pert_zh: 在法国学校放假期间，他们还研究了法国流感扩散的动态趋势，并注意到在学校关闭期间，流感病例数下降，而在学校重新开学后，病例数反弹。
bt_pert_zh: They also studied the dynamics of influenza spread in France during the French school holidays and noticed that the number of influenza cases decreased during the school closures and rebounded after schools reopened.

en: They noted that when teachers in Israel went on strike during the flu season of 1999–2000, visits to doctors and the number of respiratory infections dropped by more than a fifth and more than two fifths respectively.
zh: 他们指出，在1999–2000年以色列流感发病期，以色列教师举行了罢工，就医人数和呼吸道感染人数分别下降了五分之一以上和五分之二以上。
pert_zh: 他们指出，在1999–2000年以色列流感发病期，以色列教师举行了罢工，呼吸道感染人数和就医人数分别下降了五分之二以上和五分之一以上。
bt_pert_zh: They note that during the 1999–2000 influenza epidemic in Israel, when Israeli teachers went on strike, respiratory infections and medical visits fell by more than two-fifths and more than one-fifth, respectively.

en: For schools and childcare facilities, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
zh: 对于学校和儿童福利机构，美国疾病控制与预防中心建议，如果有已感染的患者曾在学校教学楼逗留过，不论病毒在社区内的扩散情况如何，都应进行短期封闭，以便进行清洁或消毒。
pert_zh: 美国疾病控制与预防中心建议，对于学校和儿童福利机构，如果有已感染的患者曾在学校教学楼逗留过，不论病毒在社区内的扩散情况如何，都应进行短期封闭，以便进行清洁或消毒。
bt_pert_zh: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that schools and child welfare facilities be closed for short periods of time for cleaning or disinfection if an infected person has been in the school building, regardless of the spread of the virus in the community.

en: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as cancelling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
zh: 当社区传染程度极低或不严重时，可以实施保持社交距离的策略，例如，取消野外郊游、集会以及其他大型聚会（如体育课、合唱班或在餐厅就餐）、增大课桌之间的空间、错峰上下学、限制非必要的来访者，以及对出现疑似流感症状的儿童安排单独的就医点。
pert_zh: 可以实施保持社交距离的策略，例如，取消野外郊游、集会以及其他大型聚会（如体育课、合唱班或在餐厅就餐）、增大课桌之间的空间、错峰上下学、限制非必要的来访者，以及对出现疑似流感症状的儿童安排单独的就医点，当社区传染程度极低或不严重时。
bt_pert_zh: Social distancing strategies, such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings (such as physical education classes, choir classes, or dining halls), increasing the space between desks, staggering school start and end times, limiting nonessential visitors, and providing separate medical care for children with flu-like symptoms, can be implemented when community transmission is minimal or not severe.

en: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.
zh: 如果当地社区出现了大量传染，除了实施保持社交距离策略之外，还可以考虑延长学校假期。
pert_zh: 除了实施保持社交距离策略之外，如果当地社区出现了大量传染，还可以考虑延长学校假期。
bt_pert_zh: In addition to implementing social distancing strategies, extending school holidays could be considered if there is a significant amount of transmission in the local community.

en: On 26 January, China instituted measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak which included extending the Spring Festival holiday to contain the outbreak.

en: On 3 March, UNESCO released the first global numbers on school closures and affected students.

bt_pert_zh: On March 3, UNESCO released the first global figures on school closures and students affected.

en: It reported that 13 countries had enacted preventive measures including the temporary closure of schools and universities, impacting 290.5 million students around the world.
zh: 它报告说，有13个国家/地区颁布了预防性措施，其中包括暂时关闭中小学和大学，这影响了全球2.905亿学生。

bt_pert_zh: These included the temporary closure of schools and universities, with 13 countries enacting preventive measures, affecting 290.5 million students worldwide, the report said.

en: In reaction, UNESCO called on countries to support affected students and families and facilitate large-scale inclusive distance learning programmes.
zh: 作为回应，联合国教科文组织呼吁各个国家/地区为受影响的学生和家庭提供支持，并推动大范围实施全纳远程学习课程。
pert_zh: 作为回应，联合国教科文组织呼吁各个国家/地区为受影响的学生和家庭提供支持，并推动大范围实施全纳远程学习课程。为了实现这一目标，教科文组织呼吁各个国家/地区。

zh: 3月4日，意大利政府下令全国所有的中小学和大学全部关闭，因为意大利的死亡人数已达100人。

zh: 3月5日，受COVID-19紧急措施影响的大部分学生都在中国，受影响学生人数为2.33亿人，其次是日本的1650万人和伊朗的1450万人。

bt_pert_zh: As of March 5, the majority of students affected by COVID-19 emergency measures were in China, with 233 million students affected, followed by 16.5 million in Japan and 14.5 million in Iran.

en: On 13 March, governments in 49 countries announced or implemented school closures, including 39 countries which closed schools nationwide and 22 countries with localised school closures.
zh: 3月13日，49个国家/地区的政府宣布或实施了关闭学校措施，其中39个国家/地区在全国范围内关闭学校，22个国家/地区实施了地方性的学校关闭措施。

bt_pert_zh: As of March 19, 50% of students worldwide were affected by school closures, with 102 countries/regions closing schools at a national level and 11 countries/regions closing schools at a local level, affecting 850 million children and young people.

bt_pert_zh: The Ministry of Education signed the order as a precautionary measure aimed at preventing the spread of the respiratory disease associated with the coronavirus outbreak declared by the World Health Organization.

en: 10 countries have localised schools closures, UNESCO estimates  473,933,356  learners are potentially at risk (pre-primary to upper-secondary education) and 77,938,904 learners are potentially at risk in tertiary education.
zh: 在10个实施地方性关闭学校举措的国家/地区中，联合国教科文组织估计有473,933,356名学生可能面临风险（学前到高中教育），高等教育中有77,938,904名学生可能面临风险。
pert_zh: 联合国教科文组织估计，在10个实施地方性关闭学校举措的国家/地区中，有473,933,356名学生可能面临风险（学前到高中教育），高等教育中有77,938,904名学生可能面临风险。
bt_pert_zh: UNESCO estimates that in the 10 countries with local school closures, 473,933,356 students may be at risk (pre-primary to upper secondary education) and 77,938,904 students in higher education may be at risk.

en: Note: Figures correspond to total number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8] who could be affected should localised closures become countrywide.
zh: 注意：这些数字与接受学前、小学、初中和高中教育[ISCED 0-3级]以及接受高等教育[ISCED 5-8级]的学生总数相对应，如果地方性关闭学校举措变为全国性关闭学校，则接受高等教育的学生就会受到影响。

en: Enrolment figures based on latest UNESCO Institute of Statistics data.
zh: 入学人数基于最新的联合国教科文组织统计研究所数据。

en: School closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have shed a light on numerous issues affecting access to education, as well as broader socio-economic issues.
zh: 为应对COVID-19疫情而关闭学校反映出许多影响教育机会的问题，以及更为广泛的社会经济问题。
pert_zh: 关闭学校为应对COVID-19疫情反映出许多影响教育机会的问题，以及更为广泛的社会经济问题。
bt_pert_zh: The closure of schools in response to the COVID-19 pandemic reflects many of the issues affecting educational access, as well as broader socioeconomic issues.

en: As of March 12, more than 370 million children and youth are not attending school because of temporary or indefinite country wide school closures mandated by governments in an attempt to slow the spread of COVID-19.
zh: 截止到3月12日，为减缓COVID-19的扩散，政府要求在全国范围内暂时或无限期关闭学校，导致超过3.7亿名儿童和青年无法入校学习。
pert_zh: 为减缓COVID-19的扩散，政府要求在全国范围内暂时或无限期关闭学校截止到3月12日，导致超过3.7亿名儿童和青年无法入校学习。
bt_pert_zh: To slow the spread of COVID-19, the government required the temporary or indefinite closure of schools across the country until March 12, leaving more than 370 million children and young people unable to attend school.

en: As of 29 March, nearly 90% of the world's learners were impacted by closures.Even when school closures are temporary, it carries high social and economic costs.
zh: 截止到3月29日，全球近90%的学生受到关闭学校举措的影响。即使是暂时关闭学校，也会产生很高的社会和经济成本。
pert_zh: 全球近90%的学生受到关闭学校举措的影响，截止到3月29日。即使是暂时关闭学校，也会产生很高的社会和经济成本。
bt_pert_zh: Nearly 90% of students worldwide are affected by school closures as of March 29. Even temporary school closures have high social and economic costs.

en: The disruptions they cause affect people across communities, but their impact is more severe for disadvantaged children and their families including interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems and consequent economic cost to families who cannot work.
zh: 它们造成的中断对各个社区的人群造成了影响，但对弱势儿童及其家庭的影响尤为严重，其中包括学习中断、营养不良、儿童保育问题以及由此给无法工作的家庭带来的经济损失。
pert_zh: 中断对各个社区的人群造成了影响，但对弱势儿童及其家庭的影响尤为严重，其中包括学习中断、营养不良、儿童保育问题以及由此给无法工作的家庭带来的经济损失。
bt_pert_zh: Disruptions have impacted people across communities, but have particularly severe consequences for vulnerable children and their families, including disruption to learning, malnutrition, childcare challenges, and resulting economic losses for families who are unable to work.

en: Working parents are more likely to miss work when schools close in order to take care of their children, incurring wage loss in many instances and negatively impacting productivity.
zh: 学校关闭后，上班族家长很可能为了照顾子女而耽误工作，在许多情况下会遭受工资损失，生产效率也因此受到负面影响。
pert_zh: 上班族家长很可能在学校关闭后为了照顾子女而耽误工作，在许多情况下会遭受工资损失，生产效率也因此受到负面影响。
bt_pert_zh: Working parents are likely to miss work to care for their children after school closures, and in many cases will suffer wage losses, which will negatively affect productivity.

en: Localised school closures place burdens on schools as parents and officials redirect children to schools that are open.
zh: 地方性关闭学校的举措也会给其他学校带来负担，因为家长和官员会将孩子们重新转入还在开放的学校。
pert_zh: 地方性关闭学校的举措也会给其他学校带来负担，因为家长和官员会将孩子们重新转入还在开放的学校。
bt_pert_zh: Local moves to close schools also put a burden on other schools as parents and officials transfer children back to schools that remain open.

en: Women often represent a large share of health-care workers and often cannot attend work because of childcare obligations that result from school closures.
zh: 女性通常在医护人员中占据很大的比例，学校关闭后，她们不得不承担起看护子女的责任，所以往往无法继续工作。
pert_zh: 通常在医护人员中占据很大比例的是女性，学校关闭后，她们不得不承担起看护子女的责任，所以往往无法继续工作。
bt_pert_zh: Women, who usually make up a large proportion of medical staff, have to take on the responsibility of caring for their children when schools close, so they are often unable to continue working.

en: This means that many medical professionals are not at the facilities where they are most needed during a health crisis.
zh: 这意味着，在健康危机时期，许多医疗专业人员都无法坚守在最需要他们的地方。
pert_zh: 这意味着，在健康危机时期，许多医疗专业人员都无法坚守在最需要他们的地方。

en: Lack of access to technology or fast, reliable internet access can prevent students in rural areas and from disadvantaged families.

en: In response to school closures caused by COVID-19, UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.To aid in slowing the transmission of COVID-19, hundreds of libraries have temporarily closed.

bt_pert_zh: In the United States, many major cities have announced the closure of public libraries, including New York City, Seattle, San Francisco and Los Angeles, affecting 221 libraries.

en: For students without internet at home, this increases the difficulty of keeping up with distance learning.

en: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.
zh: 由于缺乏其他出路，上班族父母只能在停课期间将孩子独自留在家中，这可能会导致危险行为，并更多地被同龄人影响和滥用药物。

bt_pert_zh: Working parents, lacking other outlets, are leaving their children home alone during school closures, which can lead to risky behaviors, increased peer influence, and substance abuse.

en: Many children worldwide rely on free or discounted meals at schools.
zh: 全球许多儿童都依赖学校提供的免费或有补贴的餐食。
pert_zh: 全球许多儿童都依赖学校提供的有补贴或免费的餐食。
bt_pert_zh: Many children around the world rely on subsidized or free meals provided by schools.

en: When schools close, nutrition is compromised.Nutrition plays a critical role in cognitive development and academic performance for children.In Washington State, around 45% of the states 1.1 million students enrolled in traditional public and charter schools qualify for subsidised school meals.
zh: 学校关闭后，孩子们无法摄取足够的营养。而充足的营养对孩子的认知能力发展和学习表现起着至关重要的作用。在华盛顿州，110万学生就读于传统公立学校和特许学校，大约45%的学生有资格享受学校伙食补贴。

bt_pert_zh: In Washington state, 1.1 million students attend traditional public schools and charter schools, and about 45% of them are eligible for school meal subsidies. Adequate nutrition plays a vital role in children's cognitive development and academic performance, and when schools are closed, children are unable to get enough nutrition.

en: At least 520,000 students and their families may be affected by food insecurity as a result of school closures.School lunch programmes are the second-biggest anti-hunger initiative in the United States after food stamps.
zh: 学校关闭后，至少有52万名学生及其家庭可能受到食品安全问题的影响。在美国，学校午餐计划是仅次于食品券计划的第二大反饥饿倡议。

bt_pert_zh: In the United States, the school lunch program is the second largest anti-hunger initiative after the food stamp program, and at least 520,000 students and their families may be affected by food insecurity after school closures.

en: Every year, nearly 30 million children rely on schools to provide free or low-cost meals including breakfast, lunch, snacks, and even dinner.In Alabama, where state-wide school closures as of 18 March have affected over 720,000 students, the state Superintendent announced that staff in schools disproportionately affected by poverty would create meal distribution networks to provide food for students who rely on school lunches.
zh: 每年，近3000万儿童依赖于学校提供的免费伙食或成本低廉的伙食，包括早餐、午餐、零食，甚至晚餐。在阿拉巴马州，截止到3月18日，全州范围的学校关闭举措已对超过72万学生造成影响，该州的教育厅长宣布，对因贫困而受到更大影响的学校，该校工作人员将建立伙食分配网络，为依靠学校伙食的学生提供食物。
pert_zh: 每年，近3000万儿童依赖于学校提供的免费伙食或成本低廉的伙食，包括早餐、午餐、零食，甚至晚餐。在阿拉巴马州，全州范围的学校关闭举措已对超过72万学生造成影响，截止到3月18日，该州的教育厅长宣布，为因贫困而受到更大影响的学校，该校工作人员将建立伙食分配网络，为依靠学校伙食的学生提供食物。

In Alabama, the statewide school closure has affected more than 720,000 students. As of March 18, the state's education secretary announced that for schools that are more affected by poverty, school staff will establish a meal distribution network to provide food for students who rely on school meals.

en: School closures negatively impact student learning outcomes.
zh: 学校关闭举措对学生的学习效果产生了负面影响。

bt_pert_zh: The school closure initiative had a negative impact on students' learning outcomes.

en: Schooling provides essential learning and when schools close, children and youth are deprived opportunities for growth and development.

en: The disadvantages are disproportionate for under-privileged learners who tend to have fewer educational opportunities beyond school.Student drop-out rates tend to increase as an effect of school closures due to the challenge of ensuring all students return to school once school closures ends.
zh: 这种影响对来自贫困家庭的学生更为严重，因为他们接受校外教育的机会更少。受到学校关闭的影响，学生辍学率往往会增加，因为在学校复课后，很难确保所有学生都能返回学校。
pert_zh: 这种影响对来自贫困家庭的学生更为严重，因为他们接受校外教育的机会更少。学生辍学率往往会增加受到学校关闭的影响，因为在学校复课后，很难确保所有学生都能返回学校。
bt_pert_zh: The impact is more severe for students from poorer families, who have less access to out-of-school education. Student dropout rates tend to increase due to school closures, as it is difficult to ensure that all students return to school when classes resume.

en: This is especially true of protracted closures.Schools are hubs of social activity and human interaction.
zh: 学校持久性关闭造成的影响更为明显。因为学校是社会活动和人际交往的中心。

bt_pert_zh: The impact of prolonged school closures is even more pronounced because schools are centers of social activity and interpersonal interaction.

pert_zh: 学校关闭后，许多儿童和青年失去了社交的机会，这些机会对于他们的学习和发展都至关重要。家长往往需要在家中督促子女学习，这项任务十分艰巨，家长对此苦不堪言，学校关闭后。

bt_pert_zh: This is especially true for parents with less education and limited resources.

en: Potential impacts of school closures and reliance on distance learning are not addressed in federal acts of legislation at this time.
